messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### maxSumOfThreeSubarrays 
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(nums: List[int], k: int) -> List[int]:   # --- py stmt 2
    s = s1 = s2 = s3 = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    mx1 = mx12 = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    idx1, idx12 = 0, ()   # --- py stmt 5
    ans = []   # --- py stmt 6
    for i in range(k * 2, len(nums)):   # --- py stmt 7
        s1 += nums[i - k * 2]   # --- py stmt 8
        s2 += nums[i - k]   # --- py stmt 9
        s3 += nums[i]   # --- py stmt 10
        if i >= k * 3 - 1:   # --- py stmt 11
            if s1 > mx1:   # --- py stmt 12
                mx1 = s1   # --- py stmt 13
                idx1 = i - k * 3 + 1   # --- py stmt 14
            if mx1 + s2 > mx12:   # --- py stmt 15
                mx12 = mx1 + s2   # --- py stmt 16
                idx12 = (idx1, i - k * 2 + 1)   # --- py stmt 17
            if mx12 + s3 > s:   # --- py stmt 18
                s = mx12 + s3   # --- py stmt 19
                ans = [*idx12, i - k + 1]   # --- py stmt 20
            s1 -= nums[i - k * 3 + 1]   # --- py stmt 21
            s2 -= nums[i - k * 2 + 1]   # --- py stmt 22
            s3 -= nums[i - k + 1]   # --- py stmt 23
    return ans   # --- py stmt 24
### canReach 
from collections import deque   # --- py stmt 25
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 26
def f_gold(arr: List[int], start: int) -> bool:   # --- py stmt 27
    n = len(arr)   # --- py stmt 28
    q = deque([start])   # --- py stmt 29
    while q:   # --- py stmt 30
        i = q.popleft()   # --- py stmt 31
        if arr[i] == 0:   # --- py stmt 32
            return True   # --- py stmt 33
        for j in [i + arr[i], i - arr[i]]:   # --- py stmt 34
            if 0 <= j < n and arr[j] >= 0:   # --- py stmt 35
                q.append(j)   # --- py stmt 36
        arr[i] = -1   # --- py stmt 37
    return False   # --- py stmt 38
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function f_gold(nums, k) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var s = 0, s1 = 0, s2 = 0, s3 = 0;   // --- py stmt 3
    var mx1 = 0, mx12 = 0;   // --- py stmt 4
    var idx1 = 0, idx12 = 0;   // --- py stmt 5
    var ans = [];   // --- py stmt 6
    for (var i = k * 2; i < nums.length; i++) {   // --- py stmt 7
        s1 += nums[i - k * 2];   // --- py stmt 8
        s2 += nums[i - k];   // --- py stmt 9
        s3 += nums[i];   // --- py stmt 10
        if (i >= k * 3 - 1) {   // --- py stmt 11
            if (s1 > mx1) {   // --- py stmt 12
                mx1 = s1;   // --- py stmt 13
                idx1 = i - k * 3 + 1;   // --- py stmt 14
            }
            if (mx1 + s2 > mx12) {   // --- py stmt 15
                mx12 = mx1 + s2;   // --- py stmt 16
                idx12 = [idx1, i - k * 2 + 1];   // --- py stmt 17
            }
            if (mx12 + s3 > s) {   // --- py stmt 18
                s = mx12 + s3;   // --- py stmt 19
                ans = [...idx12, i - k + 1];   // --- py stmt 20
            }
            s1 -= nums[i - k * 3 + 1];   // --- py stmt 21
            s2 -= nums[i - k * 2 + 1];   // --- py stmt 22
            s3 -= nums[i - k + 1];   // --- py stmt 23
        }
    }
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 24
}


function f_gold(arr, start) {   // --- py stmt 27
    var n = arr.length;   // --- py stmt 28
    var q = [start];   // --- py stmt 29
    while (q.length > 0) {   // --- py stmt 30
        var i = q.shift();   // --- py stmt 31
        if (arr[i] == 0) {   // --- py stmt 32
            return true;   // --- py stmt 33
        }
        for (var j of [i + arr[i], i - arr[i]]) {   // --- py stmt 34
            if (0 <= j && j < n && arr[j] >= 0) {   // --- py stmt 35
                q.push(j);   // --- py stmt 36
            }
        }
        arr[i] = -1;   // --- py stmt 37
    }
    return false;   // --- py stmt 38
}


```
